nodes.text: The Tenticulon was a rarely seen, amorphous creature indigenous to Rhinnal. It was the natural aquatic predator of the Fireheads.

Most Rhinnalian natives considered the creature a myth because its existance remained unproven. A few other residents of Rhinnal however believed the Tenticulon typically does not fight what it cannot kill.

It lurked in the half-light beneath the polar ice sheets and grew to enormous size while swimming silently in the
frigid polar waters. Its body is a shapeless blob from which emenated dozens of thin, ribbon-like tentacles. Each of these tentacles were specialised: Some of its limbs conjured a bioluminescent, blinking light to bewitch passing fish, others stinged and some tentacles grasped, constricted and rended. The Tenticulon was able to regrow its lost appendages. With five tentacles it was capable of swallowing a humanoid whole but typically just preyed on the fish.
The Tenticulon was able to breathe underwater and is immune to heat.
